radiographic_examinations.findings: 18 mm enhancing mass displacing the right optic nerve with flow void on T2 imaging consistent with a hemangioblastoma.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Unchanged upon follow-up in 1997; visual field defects slightly worsened in 1998.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Homogenously enhancing lesion in the suprasellar region abutting the left aspect of the optic chiasm.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased in size on follow-up MRI 6 months later with mild compression of the left temporal region of the optic chiasm.

radiographic_examinations.findings: 7 mm mass of the intracanalicular portion of the left optic nerve associated with mild edema of the optic chiasm.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Essentially unchanged in size, but increased chiasmal edema tracked further along the optic tracts as of January 2007.

radiographic_examinations.findings: 10 mm enhancing mass lesion involving the left optic nerve.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up MRI demonstrated contrast signal change in the region of previous resection that has remained stable for 12 years.
